comment.author: 45104424@N00
comment._content: Wombeyan Caves are limestone caves to the west of the highway between Goulburn and Mittagong. There are two ways in - from the Goulburn to Oberon road, which is on a relatively straightforward sealed road, or from Mittagong which is a narrow, twisting unsealed road. This tunnel is on the road from Mittagong. The tunnel in March 2009

comment.author: 61361160@N00
comment._content: This photograph is part of the Indicommons.org then-and-now feature Tunnel, Wombeyan Caves Road. Love that you could add more info from this!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The capstone of the arch inscribed "AD 1899" has an amusing story told in great style here - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/14292766 . Wombeyan Caves Road was originally known as the Duprez Road after Adolf Duprez, and officially opened in January 1900.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] That's amazing. And spooky - the Ghost of Photographers Past. I have been looking for this tunnel on Google Street View for yonks, based on the wrong geotagging of [http://www.flickr.com/photos/iansand] and [http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum]. This is the right location (press 'Link' for ultra precise geo information buried in the URL) - maps.google.com/maps?hl=en&ie=UTF8&hq=&hnear=...

comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Glad I was able to help (without even knowing it). I find it amazing Google have 'Street Viewed' that dirt road at all.
 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum] The precise geo ref (extracted from the link) is -34.344521,150.210582

comment.author: 45104424@N00
comment._content: Lu Did you look at beachcomberaustralia's video? That is the good bit of the road. On a good day you would only get a wombat and an echidna at the tunnel.
